page.title: 01SUMMARY OF AREA
page.content: The area as a whole is dominated by large tracts of moorland and one major valley through which flows the river Breamish. The valley floor is around 500'. From here the land rises to around 1800' with bare craggy outcrops. Another notable feature is the almost total lack of population. The only centre of note is Linhope itself only a tiny hamlet. The remainder of the population is found in isolated hill farms. The area is one of the most remote parts of Northumberland with only one tiny road providing access.
